content.description:
Thin face climbing gives way to easier climbing in a groove above.

Spelled funny to differentiate from the 5.8 face to groove in olson's book, 2 routes over
content.protection: small pro above, the harder moves at the bottom won't take any pro. best top roped.
content.location: From the 3rd set of mazamas anchors above, this is significantly off to the climbers left, just before the entrance to the ravine

content.description: Easy blocky arete climb. Olsen's book calls these climbs out as 5.7-5.10, this felt easier
content.location: The farthest west of the mazamas bolted anchors on the east grotto, the arete next to the access ravine

content.description: another easy blocky climb on the face of the east grotto.
content.location: second farthest west of the mazamas bolted anchors.

content.protection: pro to 1", top is a little run out, but maybe smaller gear would help. bolted anchors
content.location: second east-most set of mazamas bolts, clearly visible from above

content.description: Awkward corner below a ledge. After mantling the ledge, a crack system in the corner leads to bolted anchors.
content.protection: Bolted anchors set back from the cliff edge. Beware of the ledge, careful redirects will be needed to avoid sawing the rope along the edge
content.location: From the top, there are a middle set of bolts, with a 3rd bolt ~10 feet closer to the cliff edge. The route ends directly at the cliff edge near the 3rd bolt.

content.description: Crack in the center of what Tim Olson calls "Sunny Patina"
content.location: # 36 in NW Oregon Rock.  In Main Corridor in the middle of the Butte, the route is on the left side as you are entering the corridor.  Olson calls this boulder "Sunny Patina". One route to the right of Arrowhead.

content.description: From Olson's NW Oregon Rock: "Two thin cracks power up away from the corner.  Using both thin cracks work up rightward and trick your way carefully onto the slopers above.  Eliminates possible."
content.location: # 37 in NW Oregon Rock.  In Main Corridor in the middle of the Butte, the route is on the left side as you are entering the corridor.  Olson calls this boulder "Sunny Patina". Two routes to the right of Arrowhead.

content.description: Follow the cracks alongside the namesake thin block, then mantle to a series of grooves. Scramble at the top joins with Groove (5.5) next door
content.location: obvious cracks and thin block at the north corner of the long wall

content.description: Start at a finger crack with holds to the right. Pull through this and continue up the crack to an inset below the overhang. Use either crack to pull through this, get your feet pasted, and make a few easier moves to the ledge.
content.location: Center of the "Long Wall" which is the tallest portion on the interior of the bluff, NW-facing, closest to the east entrance

content.description: A slabby groove that eases to a scramble at the top
content.protection: Gear to 2", depending on how far up the scramble you build an anchor
content.location: end of the long wall, just next to the ravine scramble.

content.description: blocky and stemmy climb, lots of cracks on either side of the dihedral
content.location: This is the southernmost bolted anchor on the long wall. Olsen just lists "green slab" in that area.

content.description: Follow face holds up to a short crack system near the top
content.protection: Bolted anchors some 20 feet back from the edge. Small pro to 1" near the top, but the bottom is tricky. best as a top rope.
content.location: directly below the east-most bolts on the long wall
